intro: Catabrosa balansae, commonly known as the Balansae catabrosa, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking pink to purple flowers and fuzzy, heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
